message.content:
cs.CR, cs.CV, cs.MM, cs.HC, cs.CY 

This paper discusses a new method for mobile authentication that uses imaging sensors to extract authentication credentials from user-captured images. As such, it could fit into several different arXiv CS sub-categories. 

The most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security), as the paper focuses on the security implications of biometric authentication and proposes a new method for authentication that is more secure. 

The second most likely category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition), as the paper discusses the use of imaging sensors to extract authentication credentials from images. 

The third most likely category is cs.MM (Multimedia), as the paper deals with the use of images for authentication. 

The fourth most likely category is cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction), as the paper discusses the convenience and usability of biometric authentication and proposes an alternative method that is equally convenient. 

The fifth most likely category is cs.CY (Computers and Society), as the paper discusses the personal implications of biometric authentication and the need for alternative authentication methods that take these implications into account.
